title: Totally stumped on this one . . .
content:
Hey Everybody,

Having some trouble identifying this typeface, the only character I have for reference is the period . . .

Thanks in advance for your help!

Stuart :D

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [period.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160639/http:/typophile.com/files/period_0.gif) | 303 bytes |

 [‹ archetypal neon sign font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160639/http:/typophile.com/node/43791 "Go to previous forum topic") [Beeline Slab Serif profile typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160639/http:/typophile.com/node/43779 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Diner

comments.content:
nice one,

but it ain’t April for another 38 min. on the east coast yet!
I don’t think it’s Helvetica; none of the Helvetica Neue periods look like perfect squares.

Obviously it’s been squooshed then.

- Lex

first thought was Russell Square, but no.

looks like it might be pre-digital, possibly a photo lettering effort.

do you know the source?

I’m such an idiot. It’s not squooshed Helvetica, it’s squooshed Arial. How could I ever get those confused?

- Lex

Thanks for indulging my attempt at an April Fools Day joke . . . I finally ID’d the font as Hand Lettered :D

Not nearly as clever as my Fontographer MX one that probably threw Ted Harrison into a tizzy but I’m already working on next years :D
